bacterial_wilt.description: Bacterial wilt is caused by Ralstonia solanacearum, which blocks the vascular system of the plant, causing wilting and yellowing of leaves.

organic_remedies.name: Crop Rotation
organic_remedies.description: Rotate ginger with non-host crops like cereals or legumes for 3-4 years to break the disease cycle.
organic_remedies.application: Plant non-susceptible crops in infected areas

organic_remedies.name: Neem Cake Treatment
organic_remedies.description: Apply neem cake to soil to suppress bacterial populations and improve soil health.
organic_remedies.application: Mix 200-250 kg neem cake per hectare into soil before planting

organic_remedies.name: Trichoderma Application
organic_remedies.description: Bio-control agent that competes with pathogenic bacteria and enhances plant immunity.
organic_remedies.application: Mix 5 kg Trichoderma with 100 kg FYM and apply per hectare

organic_remedies.name: Resistant Varieties
organic_remedies.description: Plant disease-resistant ginger varieties if available in your region.
organic_remedies.application: Source certified disease-free rhizomes from reputable suppliers

organic_remedies.name: Soil Solarization
organic_remedies.description: Use solar heat to kill soil-borne bacteria before planting.
organic_remedies.application: Cover moist soil with transparent plastic for 4-6 weeks in hot season

chemical_remedies.name: Streptocycline Treatment
chemical_remedies.description: Antibiotic spray effective against bacterial wilt.
chemical_remedies.application: Spray 500 ppm (0.5 g/L) streptocycline solution. Drench soil around infected plants.
chemical_remedies.timing: At first sign of infection, repeat every 10-15 days
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Wear protective gear. Observe withdrawal period before harvest.

chemical_remedies.name: Copper Oxychloride
chemical_remedies.description: Broad-spectrum bactericide for preventive and curative control.
chemical_remedies.application: Spray 0.3% copper oxychloride (3 g/L) solution on foliage and soil drench
chemical_remedies.timing: Preventive sprays every 15-20 days during monsoon
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Avoid spraying during hot weather. Maintain 15-day pre-harvest interval.

chemical_remedies.name: Bleaching Powder Soil Treatment
chemical_remedies.description: Disinfect soil to reduce bacterial load in heavily infected areas.
chemical_remedies.application: Apply 250 kg bleaching powder per hectare and incorporate into soil
chemical_remedies.timing: 2-3 weeks before planting
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Avoid direct contact with skin. Water soil after application.

prevention_measures: Avoid injury to plants during cultivation
Remove and destroy infected plants immediately
Maintain proper spacing for air circulation

rhizome_rot.description: Rhizome rot is caused by Pythium spp. and other fungi, leading to water-soaked lesions and decay of underground rhizomes.
symptoms: Soft, mushy texture of affected rhizomes
Yellowing and wilting of aerial parts
Brown to black discoloration of rhizome

organic_remedies.name: Trichoderma viride
organic_remedies.description: Biocontrol fungus that parasitizes pathogenic fungi and promotes plant health.
organic_remedies.application: Treat seed rhizomes with Trichoderma suspension (10 g/L) for 30 minutes before planting
organic_remedies.timing: Before planting and as soil drench monthly

organic_remedies.name: Pseudomonas fluorescens
organic_remedies.description: Beneficial bacteria that suppress soil-borne pathogens.
organic_remedies.application: Rhizome treatment with 10 g/L suspension for 30 minutes. Soil application at 5 kg/ha with FYM
organic_remedies.timing: At planting and 45-60 days after planting

organic_remedies.name: Wood Ash Application
organic_remedies.description: Alkaline wood ash creates unfavorable conditions for fungal growth.
organic_remedies.application: Dust seed rhizomes with wood ash before planting. Apply 2-3 tons/ha to soil

organic_remedies.name: Neem Oil Spray
organic_remedies.description: Antifungal properties of neem help control fungal infections.
organic_remedies.application: Spray 3-5% neem oil solution on foliage and as soil drench

organic_remedies.name: Improved Drainage
organic_remedies.description: Proper drainage prevents waterlogging, reducing fungal infection risk.
organic_remedies.application: Plant on raised beds (15-20 cm height). Install drainage channels.

chemical_remedies.name: Mancozeb
chemical_remedies.description: Contact fungicide effective against Pythium and other fungi.
chemical_remedies.application: Treat rhizomes with 0.3% mancozeb (3 g/L) for 30 min. Soil drench at 0.25%
chemical_remedies.timing: Before planting and as preventive spray every 15 days
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Wear mask and gloves. Maintain 15-day pre-harvest interval.

chemical_remedies.name: Metalaxyl + Mancozeb
chemical_remedies.description: Systemic and contact fungicide combination for better control.
chemical_remedies.application: Rhizome treatment: 2.5 g/L for 20-30 min. Foliar spray: 2 g/L every 10-15 days
chemical_remedies.timing: At planting and during rainy season
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Use protective equipment. Follow label instructions strictly.

chemical_remedies.name: Bordeaux Mixture
chemical_remedies.description: Traditional copper-based fungicide for protective action.
chemical_remedies.application: Spray 1% Bordeaux mixture (10 g copper sulfate + 10 g lime per liter)
chemical_remedies.timing: Monthly applications starting from 2 months after planting
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Prepare fresh mixture. Avoid during hot sunny days.

chemical_remedies.name: Captan
chemical_remedies.description: Broad-spectrum protectant fungicide.
chemical_remedies.application: Dust rhizomes with 2% captan powder or dip in 0.2% suspension
chemical_remedies.timing: Before planting
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Avoid inhalation. Wear protective gear during application.

prevention_measures: Practice crop rotation with non-host crops
Remove infected rhizomes and destroy them

leaf_spot.description: Leaf spot is caused by Phyllosticta zingiberi, creating small brown spots with yellow halos on leaves, reducing photosynthesis.
symptoms: Spots may coalesce forming larger patches
Premature leaf drop in severe cases

organic_remedies.name: Garlic Extract Spray
organic_remedies.description: Natural antifungal properties help control leaf spot.
organic_remedies.application: Blend 100g garlic with 1L water, strain, dilute 1:10 and spray on foliage
organic_remedies.timing: Weekly applications at first sign of disease

organic_remedies.name: Baking Soda Solution
organic_remedies.description: Alkaline spray creates unfavorable conditions for fungal growth.
organic_remedies.application: Mix 5g baking soda + 5ml oil + 1L water. Spray on both sides of leaves

organic_remedies.name: Neem Oil + Soap Spray
organic_remedies.description: Antifungal neem oil with spreading agent for better coverage.
organic_remedies.application: Mix 10ml neem oil + 5ml liquid soap in 1L water. Spray thoroughly
organic_remedies.timing: Fortnightly sprays starting from 45 days after planting

organic_remedies.name: Copper-based Organic Fungicide
organic_remedies.description: Organic copper formulations provide protective action.
organic_remedies.application: Follow manufacturer's instructions for organic copper products

organic_remedies.name: Proper Sanitation
organic_remedies.description: Remove infected leaves to reduce disease spread.
organic_remedies.application: Remove and destroy spotted leaves. Keep field clean of debris

chemical_remedies.name: Carbendazim
chemical_remedies.description: Systemic fungicide effective against leaf spot pathogens.
chemical_remedies.application: Spray 0.1% carbendazim (1 g/L) solution on foliage
chemical_remedies.timing: At first appearance, repeat every 15 days
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Wear protective clothing. Observe 15-day pre-harvest interval.

chemical_remedies.name: Mancozeb
chemical_remedies.description: Broad-spectrum protective fungicide.
chemical_remedies.application: Spray 0.25% mancozeb (2.5 g/L) solution covering all leaf surfaces
chemical_remedies.timing: Preventive sprays every 10-15 days during rainy season
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Use mask and gloves. Avoid spray drift.

chemical_remedies.name: Propiconazole
chemical_remedies.description: Systemic triazole fungicide with curative action.
chemical_remedies.application: Spray 0.1% (1 ml/L) propiconazole solution
chemical_remedies.timing: At disease initiation, repeat after 20-25 days
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Highly toxic. Use full protective gear. Follow label strictly.

chemical_remedies.name: Chlorothalonil
chemical_remedies.description: Broad-spectrum protectant fungicide.
chemical_remedies.application: Spray 0.2% chlorothalonil (2 g/L) solution
chemical_remedies.timing: Preventive application every 15 days
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Avoid contact with skin. Maintain pre-harvest interval.

prevention_measures: Plant in well-ventilated areas with good air circulation
Avoid overhead irrigation; use drip irrigation

soft_rot.description: Soft rot is primarily caused by Erwinia species, leading to rapid breakdown of plant tissues with characteristic foul odor.
symptoms: Strong foul odor from infected areas

organic_remedies.name: Bacillus subtilis Application
organic_remedies.description: Beneficial bacteria that suppress soft rot pathogens.
organic_remedies.application: Spray 10 g/L Bacillus subtilis solution on plants and soil drench

organic_remedies.name: Hydrogen Peroxide Treatment
organic_remedies.description: Oxidizing agent that kills bacteria on contact.
organic_remedies.application: Spray 3% hydrogen peroxide solution diluted 1:10 with water
organic_remedies.timing: At first sign of infection, repeat every 5-7 days

organic_remedies.name: Cinnamon Powder Dusting
organic_remedies.description: Natural antibacterial properties help prevent wound infection.
organic_remedies.application: Dust cinnamon powder on wounds and cut surfaces during harvesting
organic_remedies.timing: After any mechanical injury or during harvest

organic_remedies.name: Mustard Cake Extract
organic_remedies.description: Contains compounds with antibacterial activity.
organic_remedies.application: Soak 1 kg mustard cake in 10L water for 24h, filter and spray

organic_remedies.name: Improved Cultivation Practices
organic_remedies.description: Cultural methods to reduce infection risk.
organic_remedies.application: Avoid injuries, improve drainage, remove infected plants immediately

chemical_remedies.name: Streptocycline + Copper Oxychloride
chemical_remedies.description: Combination of antibiotic and bactericide for enhanced control.
chemical_remedies.application: Mix streptocycline (100 ppm) with copper oxychloride (0.3%). Spray and soil drench
chemical_remedies.timing: At first symptoms, repeat every 10 days
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Wear protective gear. Follow resistance management practices.

chemical_remedies.name: Copper Hydroxide
chemical_remedies.description: Fixed copper bactericide with good residual activity.
chemical_remedies.application: Spray 0.3% copper hydroxide (3 g/L) solution
chemical_remedies.timing: Preventive sprays every 15 days during wet season
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Avoid phytotoxicity by not spraying in very hot weather.

chemical_remedies.name: Tetracycline
chemical_remedies.description: Antibiotic effective against gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria.
chemical_remedies.application: Spray 500 ppm tetracycline solution (0.5 g/L)
chemical_remedies.timing: At infection onset, repeat every 7-10 days
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Use as last resort. Observe proper withdrawal period.

yellow_disease.description: Yellow disease is caused by Fusarium oxysporum, a soil-borne fungus that causes vascular wilt and yellowing of leaves.
symptoms: Yellowing of lower leaves progressing upward

organic_remedies.name: Trichoderma harzianum
organic_remedies.description: Aggressive biocontrol fungus effective against Fusarium.
organic_remedies.application: Treat rhizomes with 10 g/L suspension. Apply 5 kg/ha mixed with FYM
organic_remedies.timing: Before planting and at 45, 90 days after planting

organic_remedies.name: Aspergillus niger
organic_remedies.description: Biocontrol agent that produces antifungal metabolites.
organic_remedies.application: Apply 5 kg/ha Aspergillus niger formulation with organic matter

organic_remedies.name: Farmyard Manure (FYM) + Neem Cake
organic_remedies.description: Improves soil health and suppresses pathogenic fungi.
organic_remedies.application: Apply 20-25 tons FYM + 1 ton neem cake per hectare

organic_remedies.name: Turmeric Extract
organic_remedies.description: Curcumin has antifungal properties against Fusarium.
organic_remedies.application: Soak 100g turmeric powder in 1L water overnight, filter, dilute 1:5 and spray

organic_remedies.name: Soil Solarization
organic_remedies.description: Solar heat reduces Fusarium population in soil.
organic_remedies.application: Cover moist soil with transparent plastic for 6 weeks in summer

chemical_remedies.name: Carbendazim
chemical_remedies.description: Systemic benzimidazole fungicide effective against Fusarium.
chemical_remedies.application: Rhizome treatment: 0.2% (2 g/L) for 30 min. Soil drench: 0.1%
chemical_remedies.timing: Before planting and as drench every 30 days
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Wear gloves and mask. Avoid contaminating water sources.

chemical_remedies.name: Thiophanate Methyl
chemical_remedies.description: Systemic fungicide with preventive and curative action.
chemical_remedies.application: Spray 0.1% (1 g/L) solution or soil drench at 2 g/L
chemical_remedies.timing: At first symptoms, repeat every 20-25 days
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Use protective equipment. Observe pre-harvest interval.

chemical_remedies.name: Propiconazole
chemical_remedies.description: Triazole fungicide with systemic movement.
chemical_remedies.application: Soil drench with 0.1% (1 ml/L) solution around plant base
chemical_remedies.timing: Preventive application at 60 and 120 days after planting
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Highly toxic. Follow label instructions strictly.

chemical_remedies.name: Tebuconazole
chemical_remedies.description: Systemic triazole fungicide for Fusarium control.
chemical_remedies.application: Rhizome treatment: 0.1% (1 ml/L) for 30 min. Foliar spray: 0.05%
chemical_remedies.timing: Before planting and as foliar spray every 30 days
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Use protective gear. Avoid spray drift.

root_knot_nematode.description: Root knot nematode (Meloidogyne spp.) attacks roots forming galls, reducing nutrient and water uptake, causing stunting and yield loss.
symptoms: Galls or knots on roots and rhizomes

organic_remedies.name: Paecilomyces lilacinus
organic_remedies.description: Nematophagous fungus that parasitizes nematode eggs.
organic_remedies.application: Apply 5 kg/ha Paecilomyces formulation mixed with FYM or compost
organic_remedies.timing: At planting and 60 days after planting

organic_remedies.name: Neem Cake Application
organic_remedies.description: Releases compounds toxic to nematodes and improves soil health.
organic_remedies.application: Apply 1-2 tons neem cake per hectare, incorporate into soil

organic_remedies.name: Marigold Trap Cropping
organic_remedies.description: Marigold attracts nematodes but doesn't allow reproduction.
organic_remedies.application: Plant African marigold as border crop or intercrop every 4-5 rows
organic_remedies.timing: Along with ginger or as preceding crop

organic_remedies.name: Pseudomonas fluorescens
organic_remedies.description: Produces toxic compounds and competes with nematodes.
organic_remedies.application: Rhizome treatment: 10 g/L for 30 min. Soil application: 5 kg/ha with FYM
organic_remedies.timing: Before planting and at 45 days after planting

organic_remedies.name: Organic Matter Amendment
organic_remedies.description: High organic matter supports beneficial organisms that suppress nematodes.
organic_remedies.application: Apply 25-30 tons well-decomposed FYM or compost per hectare

organic_remedies.name: Castor Cake
organic_remedies.description: Contains ricinine, toxic to nematodes.
organic_remedies.application: Apply 500-750 kg castor cake per hectare, incorporate into soil

chemical_remedies.name: Carbofuran
chemical_remedies.description: Systemic nematicide and insecticide granules.
chemical_remedies.application: Apply 30-40 kg Carbofuran 3G per hectare at planting, incorporate into soil
chemical_remedies.timing: At planting time
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Highly toxic. Wear gloves. Do not use bare hands. Being phased out in many countries.

chemical_remedies.name: Phorate
chemical_remedies.description: Organophosphate nematicide with systemic action.
chemical_remedies.application: Apply 10-15 kg Phorate 10G per hectare in furrows before planting
chemical_remedies.timing: At planting
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Highly toxic. Use protective equipment. Avoid skin contact. Restricted in many regions.

chemical_remedies.name: Cartap Hydrochloride
chemical_remedies.description: Nereistoxin analogue with nematicidal activity.
chemical_remedies.application: Apply 10-12 kg Cartap 4G per hectare at planting
chemical_remedies.timing: At planting and 60 days after planting
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Moderately toxic. Wear protective gear.

chemical_remedies.name: Dazomet
chemical_remedies.description: Soil fumigant that releases methylisothiocyanate.
chemical_remedies.application: Apply 300-400 kg/ha, incorporate 15-20 cm deep, cover with plastic for 2 weeks
chemical_remedies.timing: 4-6 weeks before planting
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Highly toxic gas. Professional application recommended. Clear area of people/animals.

prevention_measures: Practice crop rotation with non-host crops (cereals, pulses)
Hot water treatment of rhizomes (51Â°C for 10 minutes)
Deep summer ploughing to expose nematodes to sun
Avoid movement of soil/equipment from infected fields

healthy.description: Preventive measures and best practices to maintain healthy ginger plants and prevent disease occurrence.

organic_remedies.name: Balanced Nutrition
organic_remedies.description: Proper nutrition enhances plant immunity and disease resistance.
organic_remedies.application: Apply 25-30 tons FYM + 60:50:120 kg NPK per hectare in split doses
organic_remedies.timing: FYM before planting, NPK in 3-4 splits during growing season

organic_remedies.name: Compost Tea Spray
organic_remedies.description: Beneficial microbes boost plant health and suppress pathogens.
organic_remedies.application: Brew 1 kg compost in 10L water for 24h, strain and spray

organic_remedies.name: Mulching
organic_remedies.description: Conserves moisture, regulates temperature, and suppresses weeds.
organic_remedies.application: Apply 5-7 cm layer of organic mulch (leaves, straw, grass)
organic_remedies.timing: After planting and replenish as needed

organic_remedies.name: Vermiwash Application
organic_remedies.description: Liquid fertilizer with growth hormones and beneficial microbes.
organic_remedies.application: Dilute vermiwash 1:10 with water, spray on foliage or soil drench

chemical_remedies.name: Micronutrient Spray
chemical_remedies.description: Corrects deficiencies and enhances plant immunity.
chemical_remedies.application: Spray multi-micronutrient mixture (Zn, Fe, Mn, B) as per manufacturer's instructions
chemical_remedies.timing: 3-4 sprays at 30-day intervals starting from 45 days after planting
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Follow recommended doses. Over-application can cause toxicity.

chemical_remedies.name: Humic Acid Application
chemical_remedies.description: Improves nutrient uptake and stimulates plant growth.
chemical_remedies.application: Apply 0.1-0.2% humic acid solution as soil drench or foliar spray
chemical_remedies.timing: Monthly applications during growing season
chemical_remedies.safety_precautions: Non-toxic but follow application guidelines.

prevention_measures: Select well-drained, fertile soil with pH 5.5-6.5
Treat seed rhizomes with biocontrol agents before planting
Ensure good drainage through raised beds
Mulch to conserve moisture and suppress weeds
Monitor regularly for pest and disease symptoms
Irrigate properly - avoid waterlogging and drought stress
Remove and destroy any infected plants immediately
Avoid working in wet fields to prevent disease spread
